Review.Titre: Do not use doctorSIM to TopUp a Bell Mobility phone!!!If you are outside the usual coverage…
Review.Contenu: If you are outside the usual coverage area of Bell Mobility (North America) do not give this doctorSIM any money. They are unable to apply the credits directly to a Bell telephone. They give you an alphanumeric code and instructions to call Bell Mobility. If you have no credit on your Bell Mobility phone, you can't call Bell. DoctorSIM give a 1-888 number as an option to call from another phone. As a European company they must know that does not work. Outside North America this 1-888 number can't be called. DoctorSIM will not provide a telephone number with a country code & area code that can be dialled from outside North America. doctorSIM provide no refunds. Basically a scam. Customer service solves nothing.

Review.Titre: Poor Refund Process
Review.Contenu: I paid £17.95 to unlock my device on the 3rd of October.I was advised on the 9th of October that I'd have to pay an additional £27.95. I went ahead with this as they assured me they would refund me the full amount for the unlocking if it was unsuccessful. Fast forward to the 11th of October, and I got another email telling me that the unlocking had been unsuccessful and that they were going to give me a full refund. I WAS able to get a refund, thus the 3 stars rather than one. THEY NEED TO BE UPFRONT WITH THE REAL COST.P.S.  love these hack corporate responses... I dare anyone to find the $145 fee to unlock your phone on the website. Review.Titre: Slow and expensive but ultimately worked.
Review.Contenu: To unlock my iPhone 5s from softbank, Japan, doctorSIM gave an average wait time of 6 business days with a guaranteed delivery time of 10 for a fee of $56 US. After reading the terms and conditions, I begrudgingly decided to roll the dice as by this point I felt my only other option would be to buy a new phone. During the wait, I received several emails from them to say that my unlocking was in progress. The average wait time had passed and then on the 10th business day, within the guaranteed delivery time, they informed me that my phone had been unlocked via Apple's server. Fortunately, this meant that I didn't need to enter any unlocking codes, merely to restart my phone with a previously unaccepted sim. While this all worked out and I've had no problems since, I can't help but feel that it never should have taken as long as it did and that I didn't receive my unlocking earlier simply because I paid for their regular service. Nonetheless, in an industry rife with complete scammers, at least this company delivered.
